snippet: Though President Obama won the battleground state in 2008 in part by making huge gains among rural voters, fears about the national debt could give Mitt Romney a lift.
abstract: Rural voters in Iowa, who helped Pres Obama win battleground state in 2008, are less sure of him this time; many say that despite fact their farms are doing well under Obama's agricultural policies, their fears about growing national debt and taxes may lead them to vote for Mitt Romney.

byline.contributor: Marjorie Connelly contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Though President Obama won the battleground state in 2008 in part by making huge gains among rural voters, fears about the national debt could give Mitt Romney a lift.

headline.seo: For Some Iowa Farmers, Agriculture Takes Back Seat to Economy
headline.main: Iowa Farmers Could Give Romney a Lift, Despite President’s Stance on Agriculture
headline.print_headline: Iowa Farmers Could Give Romney a Lift, Despite President’s Stance on Agriculture
